document.masterDocTitle: Phytoseiid mites of the tribe Paraseiulini Wainstein (Acari: Phytoseiidae) from sub-Saharan Africa

subSubSection.paragraph: FEMALE. (Specimen measured. Benin : 3 ; Cameroon : 5 ; Democratic Republic of Congo : 2 ; Ghana : 8 ; Sierra- Leone: 5 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 15.
Kuzinellus relentus
(Denmark & Matthysse) (female): A. Dorsal shield; B. Ventral surface; C. Spermatheca; D. Leg IV.

subSubSection.paragraph: Venter. Sternal shield smooth, with posterior margin indistinct; distances between ST 1 -ST 3 58 ( 54–61 ), ST 2 -ST 2 48 ( 43–53 ). Genital shield smooth; distance between ST 5 -ST 5 53 ( 46–58 ). Ventrianal shield mostly smooth with light reticulation around and posteriorly to anus, pentagonal, constricted laterally at level of preanal pores, anterior margin straight, 98 ( 88–112 ) long, 65 ( 58–77 ) wide at level of ZV 2 and 61 ( 54–70 ) wide at level of anus; setae JV 2 and JV 3 present; round preanal pores posteromesad to JV 2 . Caudoventral setae smooth and sharp-tipped.
Chelicera. Movable digit 20 ( 19–21 ) long, with 1 – 2 teeth; fixed digit 19 ( 19–20 ) long, with 3 teeth and a pilus dentilis .
Spermatheca. Calyx tubular, mostly slender, bulged near atrium and flaring near vesicle, 24 ( 14–32 ) long; atrium small.

Legs. Knobbed macroseta: St
IV 16
( 11–22 ). Chaetotaxy: genu II: 2 - 2 / 0, 2 / 0- 1 ; genu III: 1-2 / 0, 2 / 0-1 .

Specimens examined. Three females,
Benin :
International Institute of Tropical Agriculture Station, Abomey-Calavi, Département de l’Atlantique, on
Mallotus oppositifolius
, 1989 , G.J. de Moraes; Gangnigon, Département du Plateau, on
Securinega virosa
,
15 -X- 1991
, B. Eklou; Sakété, Département du Plateau, on
S. virosa
,
20 -VIII- 1992
, B. Eklou; all deposited at ESALQ-USP. Eight females,
Cameroon :
11 km W Diang, Eastern Province, on
Cassia
sp.,
4 -II- 1991
, L. Louis; 8 km E Nanga-Eboko, Central Province, on
Chromolaena odorata
,

,

,

Mangifera indica
,

, L.

Louis; all deposited at ESALQ-USP. Two females,

3 km E Lukala, Bas- Congo , on
C. odorata
,

, A. Onzo; all deposited at ESALQ-USP. Thirteen females,

3km E Mankessim, Central Region, on

,

2 -IV- 1990

,

15 -XII- 1991

,

,
17 -I- 1992
, M.M. Bockarie; all deposited at ESALQ- USP .

Remarks. Length of most of the dorsal setae, of the macroseta on tarsus IV and of the calyx of the spermatheca of the specimens examined varied greatly within and between countries. The specimens from Sierra- Leone are smaller than those from other countries; the smallest specimen from that country, collected in Moyamba, Gbangbama, has in general the shortest dorsal setae.
World distribution. Benin , Cameroon , Democratic Republic of Congo , Ghana , Nigeria and Sierra- Leone.
